TopicTitle: Why can't I pitch up or left?

Articles.Content:
So i just landed a rover on Tylo:

 

Pitching left and up (A and S):

 

Pitching right and down (D and W):

Note the Yaw/Roll/Pitch indicator positions in the bottom left.

 

It seems I can't pitch up at all, and I can barely yaw left.  Roll works fine.  Any clues?

 

Things I've tried:  Switching to tracking station, loading a quicksave, restarting the game.

 

 

 

Update:  Apparently the indicators are stuck in this position.  I'm not giving any input:

Edited April 10, 2023 by RoninFrog

Not being able to pitch up might just be because you're on the surface of a body, and Tylo has pretty strong gravity so that might be holding you down.

Are you sure you're not running out of electric charge? Those wheels take a lot of ec to run I think, and I don't see any solar panels/RTGs. Besides that I'm not too sure what might be preventing you from turning, unless maybe you landed on a slope or something and that might be slowing you down.
I can't remember how to do it manually as I use kOS mostly but you may have inadvertently adjusted the trim on all axis to max one direction.  Maybe you need to reset your pitch, yaw, and roll trim

1 hour ago, darthgently said:

I can't remember how to do it manually as I use kOS mostly but you may have inadvertently adjusted the trim on all axis to max one direction.  Maybe you need to reset your pitch, yaw, and roll trim

Looks like that did the trick, thanks
